intro: Acilepis sutepensis, commonly known as the Andean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Peru and northern Bolivia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, and it is valued for its ornamental beauty and traditional uses in local communities.
